title: (x) Special Collections - FF DIN {Yves, David JE}
content:
![example typeface, lightweight- curved feet](http://web.archive.org/web/20051128235437im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/40823.gif)  
   
it's narrow, lightweight, has curved feet...   
   
this seems like a common typeface, but i can't find one anywhere. any recommendations for something like this appreciated.
author: heather

comments.content: Trust the Belgian to get there first!

thank you guys! i was at a loss there, wondering where my post was, and saw in FAQ your handy policy of changing name of subject line.   
   
that was sosooo fast.   
   
if anyone knows how to find a freeware similiar option, that would be great too.

I entirely agree, thanks for the slap on the back of my hand. That was quite rude of me.   
   
I'm just working with this small arts organisation right now, and grr... budgets are tight.   
   
Back when I had money, I purchased an actual font. (Solex) for a project. I do agree with you.   
   
Thanks for your help and much respect.

this place is great, i'm sending my recomendations here.   
   
humans are far better than any algorithms in identifying fonts.   
   
and from now on, i'm going to make sure that font purchases can be included in our expenses. seriously!   
   
thanks guys.
